hero.description: A home is more than just shelter—it's a place of stability, privacy, and community. This initiative supports those creating their own homes in difficult circumstances by providing a platform for sharing designs.

guide.title: Building Better Homes
guide.description: We've designed this guide to help anyone create safer, more durable living spaces using accessible materials and techniques. Whether you're building your own shelter, helping others, or just exploring possibilities, we're here to support your journey.
guide.pathDescription: We've tailored resources for different needs. Select the option that best represents your situation.

essentials.title: What does a home need?
essentials.description: Learn what makes a shelter into a home, from weather protection to finding and repurposing materials around you.

materialsSection.title: USEFUL MATERIALS AROUND US
materialsSection.description: Building and making a house more comfortable is not only possible with building materials. In big cities, we can find many packaging materials that are suitable for making our temporary shelter cozier, more comfortable, and safer.

materialsSection.availableDescription: Navigate your surroundings with resourcefulness. Discover how everyday objects can be transformed into essential shelter components.

lookAround.title: Look Around with New Eyes

weatherProtection.title: HOW TO PROTECT FROM WEATHER
weatherProtection.description: Weather protection is essential for turning a basic shelter into a safe, comfortable home. Learn how to protect against cold, moisture, wind, and rain using accessible materials.

whyItMatters.title: Why It Matters
whyItMatters.description: Thermal insulation protects against the cold and can reduce heat loss by up to 70%. Proper insulation is crucial for comfort and sustainable living in your shelter.

exterior.title: Exterior Insulation
exterior.description: Place thermal insulation on the outside of walls like a winter coat for your building.

coverage.title: Full Coverage
coverage.description: Wrap the entire building - sides, top and bottom. The ceiling needs the thickest insulation.

frame.title: Frame Building Technique
frame.description: For frame buildings, insulation can go inside walls but must be protected with a vapor barrier.

whyItMatters.title: Why It Matters
whyItMatters.description: Vapor barriers protect against steam from cooking, washing, and breathing. Without proper moisture control, condensation can destroy insulation and damage your shelter's structure.

layered.title: Layered Wall Protection
layered.description: Use vapor barriers in walls with multiple layers to prevent moisture damage.

installation.title: Proper Installation
installation.description: Overlap vapor barrier pieces by 15cm and seal with tape when possible.

interior.title: Interior Wall Options
interior.description: Cover interior walls with recycled materials like door panels or carpet.

whyItMatters.title: Why It Matters
whyItMatters.description: A windproof layer prevents drafts that can make your shelter uncomfortable even when well insulated. It maintains interior temperature, reduces heat loss, and creates a stable indoor environment essential for comfort and energy efficiency.

exterior.title: Exterior Membrane Installation
exterior.description: Fix windproof membrane to the exterior frame using staples, nails, or strong adhesive for maximum draft protection.

sealing.title: Seal All Joints
sealing.description: Glue membrane pieces together with double-sided tape and seal all seams to prevent wind penetration and air leaks.

breathability.title: Maintain Breathability
breathability.description: Ensure the windproof layer allows some vapor to pass through for moisture escape while blocking drafts effectively.

whyItMatters.title: Why It Matters
whyItMatters.description: Ground moisture is one of the most damaging forces for any shelter. Water from rain, snow, and ground saturation can destroy materials, create unhealthy conditions, and make your shelter uninhabitable. Proper elevation and drainage are essential for long-term success.

elevate.title: Elevate Your Structure
elevate.description: Raise the building off the ground using concrete blocks, crates, or any sturdy materials to prevent ground moisture infiltration.

drainage.title: Create Proper Drainage
drainage.description: Install sloped surfaces and channels to direct water away from the foundation and prevent pooling around the structure.

roofing.title: Use Pitched Roofing
roofing.description: Angled roofs help water run off effectively instead of pooling and causing leaks or structural damage.

hero.title: Reimagining Home & Shelter
hero.subtitle: Not a House, but a Home – We believe in the power of self-built spaces to create stability and dignity. Our goal is to support, inspire, and empower people to build homes that truly feel like home.
hero.paragraph1: Housing is a fundamental right, yet many people are forced to create their own shelters outside traditional systems. This web application is a resource for those who build homes from found materials, as well as for advocates and architects working in solidarity with unhoused communities.
hero.paragraph2: A home is more than a shelter—it's a place of stability, privacy, and connection. Through design knowledge, creativity, and shared solutions, we support self-built housing as a pathway to dignity and security.
